author: Simon Sharwood
title: Lenovo China makes slow ThinkPad X1 Carbon clone ‚Ä¢ The Register
text:
Lenovo's Chinese operation has created a premium laptop based around a slow and out-of-date x86-compatible processor ‚Äì but at least it's locally designed.
Chinese state media report that the machine ‚Äì dubbed the Kaixian X1 G1d ‚Äì weighs in at 990 grams, boasts a 2800x1800 display, three USB-C ports, one USB-A slot, and an unspecified capacity for DDR4 memory.
The Zhaoxin KX-6000G chip powering the laptop offers just four cores and runs four threads. While Lenovo has apparently juiced the 3.6GHz processor to run at 3.8GHz, tests of the processor rate it as inferior to Intel and AMD desktop chips released three to five years ago.
Lenovo has nonetheless used premium packaging for the machine, which is said to resemble the ThinkPad X1 Carbon that has long been the PC leader's flagship business laptop.
The Lenovo Kaixian X1 G1d laptop - Click to enlarge
Prices start at around $1,500.
But don't try buying it from Lenovo.com.cn ‚Äì it's not there. The machine is being sold at third party online stores, while Lenovo China's own online store is full of machines packing more recent and powerful Intel and AMD processors.
But the box does feature on the website of Shanghai Zhaoxin Integrated Circuit Co., Ltd ‚Äì the silicon slinger that made its processor, using tech derived from the x86 license it acquired years ago from Taiwan's Via Technologies, which made its own modest range of processors before quitting the CPU biz and heading for other markets.
Chinese chipmaker Loongson now just three to five years off the pace on the desktop China's top Office clone copies Microsoft again ‚Äì with an inconvenient outage China Telecom's next 150,000 servers will mostly use local processors Lenovo turns to India as source of AI servers What gives? Why has Lenovo created ‚Äì and seemingly hidden ‚Äì a premium-look laptop with a poor processor?
To answer that question, remember that China wants locals to use more tech designed and built within its borders. Earlier this year Beijing even excluded AMD and Intel from a list of approved CPUs, and has also emphasized the use of locally developed operating systems.
Know, too, that Zhaoxin has Beijing's favor, and that Chinese media is hailing this laptop as the first time the chip design firm's wares have been packaged into a product.
Zhaoxin, however, has already bettered the KX-6000G. Just last week it showed off its KX-7000 series processors in a desktop PC from local box builder Tongfang Computer.
One market that could be receptive to a pretty but underpowered laptop is China's government, which has been asked to lead the transition to local tech by example.
But overall, this one is a head-scratcher. ¬Æ
Get our Tech Resources

author: Chulumanco Mahamba
title: Most of SA under heatwave until Monday and fire danger warnings | The Citizen
text:
Find out what the latest weather forecast from the SA Weather Service means for your region. Picture: Canva
The South African Weather Service (Saws) has released its latest weather forecast for Saturday, 2 November 2024.
The weather service has warned of a heatwave with persistently high temperatures across most of the provinces until Monday and high fire danger in four provinces. Here‚Äôs what you need to know.
üå°Ô∏èHeatwave with persistently high temperatures is expected over Limpopo, Mpumalanga, Gauteng, Free State, North West, as well as the north-eastern areas of Eastern Cape & KwaZulu-Natal, from Saturday (02-04 November 2024) until Monday. #saws #weatheroutlook #southafricanweather pic.twitter.com/L6F1BIxWom
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Weather warnings, 2 November Fire danger warnings Extremely high fire danger conditions are expected over the central and eastern parts of the Northern Cape, the northern interior of the Eastern Cape, and the central and western parts of both the Free State and North West provinces.
Advisories The weather service has warned of a heat wave with persistently high temperatures expected over Gauteng, Mpumalanga, Limpopo, the North West, the Free State, and the northern and north-western parts of KwaZulu-Natal until Monday but over the north-eastern interior of the Eastern Cape until Sunday.
Read more Gauteng heatwave: Residents warned to stay out of the sun this weekend Extremely hot conditions are also expected in the Lowveld and Western Bushveld of Limpopo and the Lowveld of Mpumalanga on Sunday.
ALSO READ : Gauteng heatwave: Residents warned to stay out of the sun this weekend
Provincial weather forecast Here‚Äôs what to expect in your province on Saturday, 2 November:
Gauteng:
Residents of Gauteng can expect fine and hot weather, becoming partly cloudy in the south in the afternoon. It will be very hot in the north.
The region‚Äôs expected UVB sunburn index is ‚Äúvery high.‚Äù
Residents should take the necessary precautions against prolonged sun exposure.
Gauteng Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/tZWoM7eF18
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Mpumalanga:
Mpumalanga residents can expect morning fog patches along the escarpment; otherwise, it will be fine and hot, becoming partly cloudy on the Highveld in the afternoon. It will be very hot in the Lowveld.
Mpumalanga Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/a9tjT33Czj
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Limpopo:
The day will be fine and hot to very hot.
Limpopo Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/dtWyRckBAz
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 North-West province:
Fine and hot to very hot conditions await North West residents, becoming partly cloudy with isolated thundershowers in the west.
North West Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/IwZWm3dB1g
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Free State:
Residents of the Free State will see fine and hot to very hot weather, becoming partly cloudy with isolated thundershowers except in the south.
Free State Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/pvTdJfCAV8
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Northern Cape:
The day will start with morning fog patches along the coast where it will be cool; otherwise, it will be fine and warm to hot but very hot over the central and eastern parts. It will become partly cloudy in the northeast with isolated afternoon thundershowers.
Northern Cape Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/19p3T7QilC
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Western Cape:
Western Cape residents can expect partly cloudy conditions along the coast where it will be cool; otherwise, it will be fine and warm but hot over the Central Karoo.
The region‚Äôs expected UVB sunburn index is ‚Äúextreme.‚Äù
Residents should take the necessary precautions against prolonged sun exposure.
Western Cape Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/YKCRulwEGI
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 Eastern Cape (western half):
There will be morning fog patches in the south; otherwise, it will be partly cloudy and hot to very hot but cool along the coast.
Eastern Cape (eastern half):
There will be morning fog patches south of the escarpment; otherwise, it will be fine and warm to hot but cool along the coast. It will become partly cloudy in the afternoon.
Eastern Cape Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/7Ugdb2ODYm
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024 KwaZulu-Natal:
Residents of KwaZulu-Natal can look forward to morning fog patches over the interior; otherwise, it will be partly cloudy and hot to very hot.
The region‚Äôs expected UVB sunburn index is ‚Äúextreme.‚Äù
Residents should take the necessary precautions against prolonged sun exposure.
Kwazulu Natal Tomorrow 's Weather overview: 02/11/2024 pic.twitter.com/ETCpIO60W7
‚Äî SA Weather Service (@SAWeatherServic) November 1, 2024

author: VNExplorer
title: Why are some areas 'colder' despite extreme heat? PAGASA explains
text:
This is from scitech selected image. Dry weather, exacerbated by the El Ni√±o phenomenon, has left many Filipinos drenched in sweat. But for Silvestre Aben, who grew up in La Trinidad, Benguet, it remains cool up north despite the extreme heat in most parts of the country. ‚ÄúFor this time, mga 26 degrees Celsius. Kung sa hapon, bababa pa ng mga 24¬∞C to 25¬∞C. Talagang ganito ang temperature dito sa Benguet,‚Äù he told GMA News Online. (For this time, it‚Äôs 26 degrees Celsius. In the afternoon, it reaches between 24¬∞C and 25¬∞C. This is how the temperature is here in Benguet.) ‚ÄúWalang pinagbago. Talagang ganun ang weather dito sa Benguet. Kapag aakyat ka pa sa north, mas malamig doon,‚Äù Aben added. (Nothing really changed. That‚Äôs how the weather is in Benguet. If you go up north, it‚Äôs colder there.) State weather bureau PAGASA has recorded dangerous levels of heat indexes across the country since March. Heat index is the measure of the temperature that a person feels in contrast to the actual air temperature. It is computed by factoring in the humidity and the air temperature, according to the state weather bureau. On April 28, the heat index in Iba, Zambales, rose to an extremely dangerous level of 53¬∞C ‚Äî the highest in the country so far this year. Around 25 areas also reported dangerous levels of heat indexes of up to 45¬∞C on May 9. Topography But despite the extreme heat, some areas remained relatively cooler, reporting lower heat indexes. These include Baguio City, La Trinidad, Benguet, and Tanay, Rizal. In the last five days, La Trinidad reported heat indexes of 25¬∞C (May 9), 27¬∞C (May 8), 29¬∞C (May 7), 26¬∞C (May 6), and 27¬∞C (May 5). Meanwhile, Baguio monitored heat indexes of 25¬∞C (May 9), 27¬∞C (May 8), and 28¬∞C (May 5 to May 7). The municipality of Tanay experienced heat indexes of 34¬∞C (May 9), 32¬∞C (May 8), 33¬∞C (May 7), 32¬∞C (May 6), and 33¬∞C (May 5). John Manalo, a PAGASA weather specialist, explained that an area‚Äôs terrain has an impact on the heat index. ‚ÄúMaraming factors na nagpapataas o nagpapababa ng heat index measurements na nao-obserbahan natin. Isa po dito ay ‚Äòyung elevation or ‚Äòyung topography,‚Äù said Manalo. (There are many factors affecting heat index measurements. One of the factors is elevation, or the area‚Äôs topography.) ‚Äú‚ÄôYung mga lugar na nasa highly-elevated o ‚Äòyung matataas gaya ng Baguio‚Ä¶relatively, mas malamig o lower ‚Äòyung temperature..as compared sa mga low-lying areas, halimbawa, Metro Manila,‚Äù he added. (Highly elevated areas such as Baguio City experience lower temperatures compared to low-lying areas like Metro Manila.) ‚ÄúMay role din ang distance from the nearest body of water‚Ä¶Kung sa Manila Bay, the more na mas malapit sa body of water, mas may tendency na mas mataas ang relative humidity dahil sa moisture content na dala ng mga body of water,‚Äù Manalo said. (An area‚Äôs distance to the nearest body of water also plays a role. Coastal areas such as Manila Bay have higher relative humidity due to the moisture content of the body of water.) Warmer Baguio Although Baguio is known for its cold climate, Sam Silverio noticed that today‚Äôs heat is different from the previous years. ‚ÄúHindi ganun kainit compared sa Manila, pero mainit pala compared to usual Baguio weather,‚Äù she told GMA News Online. (It‚Äôs not that hot compared to Manila, but this is hotter compared to the usual Baguio weather.) ‚ÄúGumigising na ako madalas basa ng pawis eh (I now often wake up sweating).‚Äù Rachel Santos said that the heat in Tanay is still bearable compared to Metro Manila, but she also noticed that it is different from the past. ‚ÄúAs compared sa mga nagdaang summer season, iba talaga yung init ngayon kahit saan,‚Äù she told GMA News Online. (As compared to the previous summer seasons, it is very hot anywhere else.) PAGASA said the infrastructure and establishments in an area can also influence the heat index. Dubbed the ‚Äúurban heat island effect,‚Äù cities record warmer indexes than rural areas due to the buildings and establishments around them. ‚ÄúAng urban areas ay relatively mas warmer compared sa nearby rural areas niya dahil sa differences sa structures and materials na nakikita natin sa urban areas,‚Äù said Manalo. (Urban areas are relatively warmer than rural areas because of the differences in structures and materials.) ‚ÄúAng main difference nila ay heat capacity‚Ä¶Mas maraming buildings, mas may tendency na ma-hold nila yung warm air. Unlike sa rural na magdi-dissipate agad ang warm air, sa rural naga-accumulate siya and imbis na mapunta sa upper part ng atmosphere, nagt-transfer pa siya from one building to another o hino-hold pa siya ng asphalt o concrete or metals na meron kadalasan sa urban areas,‚Äù he added. (The main difference is the heat capacity. Buildings tend to hold warm air, unlike in rural areas where the warm air easily dissipates. The warm air in urban areas accumulates and even transfers from one building to another. The asphalt, concrete, and metal materials in urban areas also hold warm air.) In Benguet, Aben said that it‚Äôs much cooler back in the day when there were still more trees. ‚ÄúNung bata pa kami, malamig na malamig nun. Kasi marami pang kahoy nun, pero ngayon wala na, naubos na ang kahoy,‚Äù he said. (When we were young, it was very cold then. Because there were still many trees, but there are fewer of them now.) ‚Äî VBL, GMA Integrated News This article Why are some areas ‚Äòcolder‚Äô despite extreme heat? PAGASA explains was originally published in GMA News Online." } Global US CH SE DK NO NL BE UK DE FR FI IT AT ES PT PL IE GR CZ TR AE CA JP KR AR BR IN
PH Why are some areas 'colder' despite extreme heat? PAGASA explains 10/05/2024
This is from scitech selected image.
Dry weather, exacerbated by the El Ni√±o phenomenon, has left many Filipinos drenched in sweat.
But for Silvestre Aben, who grew up in La Trinidad, Benguet, it remains cool up north despite the extreme heat in most parts of the country.
‚ÄúFor this time, mga 26 degrees Celsius. Kung sa hapon, bababa pa ng mga 24¬∞C to 25¬∞C. Talagang ganito ang temperature dito sa Benguet,‚Äù he told GMA News Online.
(For this time, it‚Äôs 26 degrees Celsius. In the afternoon, it reaches between 24¬∞C and 25¬∞C. This is how the temperature is here in Benguet.)
‚ÄúWalang pinagbago. Talagang ganun ang weather dito sa Benguet. Kapag aakyat ka pa sa north, mas malamig doon,‚Äù Aben added.
(Nothing really changed. That‚Äôs how the weather is in Benguet. If you go up north, it‚Äôs colder there.)
State weather bureau PAGASA has recorded dangerous levels of heat indexes across the country since March.
Heat index is the measure of the temperature that a person feels in contrast to the actual air temperature. It is computed by factoring in the humidity and the air temperature, according to the state weather bureau.
On April 28, the heat index in Iba, Zambales, rose to an extremely dangerous level of 53¬∞C ‚Äî the highest in the country so far this year.
Around 25 areas also reported dangerous levels of heat indexes of up to 45¬∞C on May 9.
Topography
But despite the extreme heat, some areas remained relatively cooler, reporting lower heat indexes. These include Baguio City, La Trinidad, Benguet, and Tanay, Rizal.
In the last five days, La Trinidad reported heat indexes of 25¬∞C (May 9), 27¬∞C (May 8), 29¬∞C (May 7), 26¬∞C (May 6), and 27¬∞C (May 5).
Meanwhile, Baguio monitored heat indexes of 25¬∞C (May 9), 27¬∞C (May 8), and 28¬∞C (May 5 to May 7).
The municipality of Tanay experienced heat indexes of 34¬∞C (May 9), 32¬∞C (May 8), 33¬∞C (May 7), 32¬∞C (May 6), and 33¬∞C (May 5).
John Manalo, a PAGASA weather specialist, explained that an area‚Äôs terrain has an impact on the heat index.
‚ÄúMaraming factors na nagpapataas o nagpapababa ng heat index measurements na nao-obserbahan natin. Isa po dito ay ‚Äòyung elevation or ‚Äòyung topography,‚Äù said Manalo.
(There are many factors affecting heat index measurements. One of the factors is elevation, or the area‚Äôs topography.)
‚Äú‚ÄôYung mga lugar na nasa highly-elevated o ‚Äòyung matataas gaya ng Baguio‚Ä¶relatively, mas malamig o lower ‚Äòyung temperature..as compared sa mga low-lying areas, halimbawa, Metro Manila,‚Äù he added.
(Highly elevated areas such as Baguio City experience lower temperatures compared to low-lying areas like Metro Manila.)
‚ÄúMay role din ang distance from the nearest body of water‚Ä¶Kung sa Manila Bay, the more na mas malapit sa body of water, mas may tendency na mas mataas ang relative humidity dahil sa moisture content na dala ng mga body of water,‚Äù Manalo said.
(An area‚Äôs distance to the nearest body of water also plays a role. Coastal areas such as Manila Bay have higher relative humidity due to the moisture content of the body of water.)
Warmer Baguio
Although Baguio is known for its cold climate, Sam Silverio noticed that today‚Äôs heat is different from the previous years.
‚ÄúHindi ganun kainit compared sa Manila, pero mainit pala compared to usual Baguio weather,‚Äù she told GMA News Online.
(It‚Äôs not that hot compared to Manila, but this is hotter compared to the usual Baguio weather.)
‚ÄúGumigising na ako madalas basa ng pawis eh (I now often wake up sweating).‚Äù
Rachel Santos said that the heat in Tanay is still bearable compared to Metro Manila, but she also noticed that it is different from the past.
‚ÄúAs compared sa mga nagdaang summer season, iba talaga yung init ngayon kahit saan,‚Äù she told GMA News Online.
(As compared to the previous summer seasons, it is very hot anywhere else.)
PAGASA said the infrastructure and establishments in an area can also influence the heat index. Dubbed the ‚Äúurban heat island effect,‚Äù cities record warmer indexes than rural areas due to the buildings and establishments around them.
‚ÄúAng urban areas ay relatively mas warmer compared sa nearby rural areas niya dahil sa differences sa structures and materials na nakikita natin sa urban areas,‚Äù said Manalo.
(Urban areas are relatively warmer than rural areas because of the differences in structures and materials.)
‚ÄúAng main difference nila ay heat capacity‚Ä¶Mas maraming buildings, mas may tendency na ma-hold nila yung warm air. Unlike sa rural na magdi-dissipate agad ang warm air, sa rural naga-accumulate siya and imbis na mapunta sa upper part ng atmosphere, nagt-transfer pa siya from one building to another o hino-hold pa siya ng asphalt o concrete or metals na meron kadalasan sa urban areas,‚Äù he added.
(The main difference is the heat capacity. Buildings tend to hold warm air, unlike in rural areas where the warm air easily dissipates. The warm air in urban areas accumulates and even transfers from one building to another. The asphalt, concrete, and metal materials in urban areas also hold warm air.)
In Benguet, Aben said that it‚Äôs much cooler back in the day when there were still more trees.
‚ÄúNung bata pa kami, malamig na malamig nun. Kasi marami pang kahoy nun, pero ngayon wala na, naubos na ang kahoy,‚Äù he said.
(When we were young, it was very cold then. Because there were still many trees, but there are fewer of them now.) ‚Äî VBL, GMA Integrated News
This article Why are some areas ‚Äòcolder‚Äô despite extreme heat? PAGASA explains was originally published in GMA News Online.

author: MarketScreener
title: EMBRAER S A : delivers 30 aircraft in the 1st quarter of 2025, 20% more than in 1Q24 | MarketScreener UK
text:
S√£o Paulo (SP), Brazil, April 2, 2025 - Embraer (NYSE: ERJ / B3: EMBR3), a global leader in the aerospace industry, delivered 30 aircraft in the first quarter of 2025. The result is 20% higher than that recorded in the first quarter of last year (1Q24), when 25 aircraft were delivered.
In comparison to the same period in 2024, Commercial Aviation volumes were stable in the quarter, with 7 aircraft delivered. Executive Aviation volumes were higher year over year: 23 jets were delivered in 1Q25 versus 18 in 1Q24 - an increase of 28%.
The company's guidance foresees between 77 and 85 deliveries in Commercial Aviation in 2025 (midpoint 10% higher in the annual comparison), and 145 to 155 in Executive Aviation (midpoint 15% higher year over year).
Check out full document: https://embraer.bynder.com/m/5288f31ec7194221/original/20250402-Release-Deliveries-1Q25-ENG.pdf
About Embraer
A global aerospace company headquartered in Brazil, Embraer has businesses in Commercial and Executive aviation, Defense and Security, and Agricultural Aviation. The company designs, develops, manufactures, and markets aircraft and systems, providing Services and Support to customers after-sales.
Since it was founded in 1969, Embraer has delivered more than 9,000 aircraft. On average, about every 10 seconds an aircraft manufactured by Embraer takes off somewhere in the world, transporting over 150 million passengers a year.
Embraer is the leading manufacturer of commercial jets with up to 150 seats and the main exporter of high value-added goods in Brazil. The company maintains industrial units, offices, service, and parts distribution centers, among other activities, across the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Europe.
Share: Attachments
Original document Permalink Disclaimer
Embraer SA published this content on April 02, 2025 , and is solely responsible for the information contained herein. Distributed via , unedited and unaltered, on April 02, 2025 at 21:43 UTC .

author: Frederick Keys
title: Keys Finish Seven-Game Road Trip with Loss against Spikes
text:
Keys Finish Seven-Game Road Trip with Loss against Spikes
July 25, 2024 -
Major League Baseball Draft League (MLBDL) Frederick Keys News Release
State College, PA- The Frederick Keys fell in the series finale to the State College Spikes Thursday afternoon, losing the third game of the series by a score of 14-7 at Medlar Field at Lubrano Park.
The Keys used a six-run top of the seventh to cut the lead to as small as two, but an early eight-run advantage for the Spikes after the sixth inning handed them the series sweep at home, as Frederick returns back to the Key City for their first home game coming up on Friday against the Mahoning Valley Scrappers.
Frederick started strong with a run in the top of the first courtesy of a wild pitch that brought home Tremayne Cobb Jr. (Troy) from third, giving the visitors an early 1-0 lead after the first half inning.
State College got an RBI single of their own in the bottom of the first to tie the game up at one heading into the second, with each side allowing two hits in the first inning of play Thursday afternoon.
After each team went scoreless in the second, the Spikes took their first lead of the day off a solo homer from Cooper Hext in the third, as State College earned a 2-1 lead entering the fourth as a result.
Following a scoreless bottom of the fourth inning thrown by Harold Baez (Bethune-Cookman), Baez followed it up with a 1-2-3 fifth inning, keeping the Keys down by only one heading into the sixth at Medlar Field at Lubrano Park.
The Spikes added to their lead in the bottom of the sixth off two RBI singles and back-to-back bases loaded walks, while a bases clearing double bumped up the lead to eight at 9-1 approaching the seventh in Happy Valley.
However, the Keys responded with six runs in the top of the seventh, after several bases loaded walks and an RBI single from Christian Jackson made it a 9-7 game entering the bottom of the seventh.
State College came back with two runs in the bottom of the seventh off a wild pitch and an RBI groundout, but Ga'Von Wray (Georgia Southern) finished the inning strong with a strikeout, as the Spikes took an 11-7 lead going into the eighth Thursday afternoon.
The Spikes tacked on three more runs in the bottom of the eighth off two RBI base hits and a wild pitch, bringing the lead back up to seven for the Spikes at 14-7 heading into the ninth, with the Keys looking for another late rally.
In the ninth, the Keys went scoreless and fell to the Spikes in the series finale, as State College earned a home series sweep Thursday afternoon by winning the series finale 14-7.
The Keys return home for the first time in the second half Friday night, when they host the Mahoning Valley Scrappers at 7 p.m. at Nymeo Field at Harry Grove Stadium.
Friday's game will represent Wrestling Night at the ballpark, with WWE Hall of Famer Jeff Jarrett present at the game. Jarrett will be available before the game for fans to meet, and there will be postgame fireworks at the conclusion of the contest.
Frederick Keys Statistics

author: BBC News
title: Delhi: Fog disrupts life and travel in northern India
text:
A thick blanket of fog has engulfed Delhi and adjoining areas in northern India, leading to travel delays and chaos.
According to tracking app flightradar24, at least 28 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport on Friday, with an average delay of 10 minutes. Reports say dozens of trains have also been rescheduled, or are running late.
India's weather department has said that foggy conditions are likely to continue for the next few days.
Dense fog is common at this time of the year in Delhi and other parts of northern India, as the region grapples with an intense cold wave.
Photos and videos showed several cities shrouded in dense mist and haze.
Around nine airports including the one in Delhi experienced zero visibility on Friday morning, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.
The Delhi airport has issued an advisory to passengers, warning them of significant delays.
"While landing and take-off continue at Delhi airport, flights that are not CAT III compliant may get affected," the airport said in a statement, referring to the radar system that enables automatic landings when there is very low visibility.
Several airlines have also issued statements urging travellers to check flight schedules before planning their journeys.
IMD considers fog "dense" if visibility drops below 200m and "very dense" if it falls below 50m.
The weather department has said that Delhi may experience light to moderate rainfall on 6 January, which is likely to further lower temperatures.
Follow BBC News India on Instagram , YouTube , Twitter and Facebook

author: RTVE.es
title: S√°nchez celebra la salida de Vox de los gobiernos auton√≥micos
text: S√°nchez celebra la salida de Vox de los gobiernos auton√≥micos: "Es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a" - El presidente asegura que el PP tiene una gran oportunidad en "la reforma de la ley de extranjer√≠a" - Defiende la "experiencia acreditada" de Escriv√° para el Banco de Espa√±a El presidente Pedro S√°nchez ha celebrado este jueves la ruptura de los acuerdos auton√≥micos de Vox y el PP a ra√≠z del reparto voluntario de menores migrantes no acompa√±ados. "Hoy es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a", ha afirmado el jefe del Ejecutivo durante una rueda de prensa en la que ha trasladado su "alegr√≠a" por la salida de la ultraderecha de los gobiernos regionales y ha llamado a los 'populares' a reformar la ley de extranjer√≠a. S√°nchez, que ha comparecido desde Washington para hacer un balance del evento de la cumbre de la OTAN, se ha referido en esos t√©rminos a la decisi√≥n del partido de Santiago Abascal de romper los pactos con el PP en Extremadura, Baleares, Arag√≥n, Comunidad Valenciana, Castilla y Le√≥n y Murcia. "La estrategia del PP de gobernar con la ultraderecha ha fracasado", ha destacado. Preguntado por los periodistas por la noticia, el presidente ha incidido en que el PP debe abordar "una decisi√≥n trascendental": ser una "oposici√≥n destructiva" o "de Estado", dando "respuesta a los problemas" de la ciudadan√≠a. "La pregunta que debe hacerse es si est√° dispuesto a romper con las pol√≠ticas que ha aprobado con Vox. Tiene una gran oportunidad y es la ley de extranjer√≠a; es la prueba del algod√≥n", ha sostenido, refiri√©ndose a la reforma que el Gobierno ha planteado para que la acogida de menores sea obligatoria. "Toda esta crisis viene provocada por el rechazo tanto de PP como de Vox a la solidaridad con Canarias", ha criticado S√°nchez, que ha vuelto a pedir a los 'populares' que "deroguen" las "contrarreformas" aprobadas y romper tambi√©n con la ultraderecha a nivel local. Desliga el retorno de Rovira de una investidura en Catalu√±a Preguntado por el regreso a Espa√±a de la secretaria general de ERC, Marta Rovira, tras haber sido archivado el caso 'Tsunami Democr√†tic', el presidente ha remarcado que su vuelta se producir√° gracias a la ley de amnist√≠a aprobada por su Gobierno y ha se√±alado que, a su juicio, una investidura de Salvador Illa (PSC) no tiene por qu√© estar vinculada a la medida de gracia. "Una cosa no tiene nada que ver con la otra", ha defendido. En este contexto, ha apelado a la "responsabilidad" de ERC para lograr un acuerdo para la investidura de Illa como nuevo presidente catal√°n. "Estamos hablando de un acuerdo de gobierno para echar a andar la legislatura en Catalu√±a. Y yo conf√≠o, evidentemente, en la responsabilidad y en el compromiso de todas las formaciones pol√≠ticas", ha se√±alado. Defiende la "experiencia acreditada" de Escriv√° para el Banco de Espa√±a Por otro lado, S√°nchez ha defendido la "experiencia acreditada en materia de pol√≠tica monetaria" del exminitro Jos√© Luis Escriv√° para gobernador del Banco de Espa√±a en sustituci√≥n de Pablo Hern√°ndez de Cos, cuyo mandato expir√≥ a comienzos del mes de junio, si bien ha confirmado que siguen las negociaciones con el PP. "Por tanto, se impone una cierta discreci√≥n por parte de los negociadores", ha explicado. No obstante, el presidente ha recordado la tradici√≥n en otros pa√≠ses en nombrar a exministros como gobernadores de sus bancos centrales, subrayando que Luis de Guindos (PP) "pas√≥ de ser ministro de Econom√≠a" en Espa√±a a vicepresidente del Banco Central Europeo. Para el jefe del Ejecutivo, "lo importante" es que la persona que se proponga para el puesto de gobernador del Banco de Espa√±a "cumpla o no con los requisitos y la cualificaci√≥n" para un puesto de estas caracter√≠sticas "en un contexto de tanta incertidumbre econ√≥mica y geopol√≠tica". As√≠, ha apuntado que Escriv√° fue presidente de la Autoridad Independiente de Responsabilidad Fiscal (AIREF) y despu√©s estuvo al frente del Ministerio de Seguridad Social donde, entre los m√©ritos que defiende S√°nchez, "ha reconstruido el Pacto de Toledo". "Y, fundamentalmente, si uno mira su curr√≠culum, creo que hay pocas personas en Espa√±a que tengan el conocimiento de pol√≠tica monetaria que tiene Jos√© Luis Escriv√°", ha zanjado.

author: KSBW via CNN Newsource
title: Missing hiker found alive after being lost for 10 days in mountains
text:
SANTA CRUZ COUNTY, Calif. (KSBW) - A missing hiker was finally rescued after he was lost for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains of California.
The 34-year-old man was only going for a three-hour hike when he disappeared.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt bring anything because I thought I was doing a three-hour hike to go to work,‚Äù Lukas McClish, the rescued hiker, said.
He was lost in the woods for nine nights and 10 days, shirtless with only a flashlight and folding scissors.
It would be more than a week before the raggedy-looking hiker would be found.
‚ÄúSo, I kind of just hiked. Each day, I go up a canyon, down a canyon to the next waterfall, sit down by the waterfall, drink water out of my boot,‚Äù Lukas McClish recalled.
It was a Tuesday when Lukas McClish went for a hike in Boulder Creek and ended up getting lost.
‚ÄúI felt comfortable the whole time I was out there. I wasn‚Äôt worried about it,‚Äù Lukas McClish said. ‚ÄúI had a mountain lion that was following me, but it was cool. It kept its distances. I think it was just somebody watching over me.‚Äù
The problem was that Lukas McClish didn‚Äôt tell anyone where he was going.
By the time Father‚Äôs Day rolled around on Sunday, his family started worrying and filed a missing person‚Äôs report.
The search was on then.
‚ÄúSome nights, although, I just had to trust God that he was going to be OK, and that was hard to do some nights when we would go to bed at night because I would worry about where he was, where he was sleeping and how cold he was and where he was if he was alive,‚Äù Diane McClish, the hiker‚Äôs mother, said.
Lukas McClish drank from water from creeks, ate wild berries and slept on a wet bed of leaves all while yelling for help and thinking of his next meal.
‚Äú‚ÄòJust help. Help, I‚Äôm over here.‚Äô Or, ‚ÄòIs anybody out there?‚Äô‚Äù Lukas McClish remembered saying while he was lost. ‚ÄúI want a burrito or a taco bowl. That‚Äôs what I thought about every day when I, after the first five days, when I started to kind of realize that I might be in over my head.‚Äù
But on Thursday afternoon, someone finally heard his cries for help.
The Boulder Creek Fire Department deployed a drone and spotted his location.
A K-9 tracked him down and Lukas McClish was escorted out of a remote canyon, finally reunited with family.
‚ÄúMet a lot of people because I had more people come to me and tell me how much they love my son and how they just hoped that we would find him,‚Äù Diane McClish said. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt realize that so many people in this town love Luke.‚Äù
Fortunately, Lukas McClish had no major injuries.
